thread.title: MLB rumors: Yankees could chase Zack Greinke - NJ.com
thread.title_full: MLB rumors: Yankees could chase Zack Greinke - NJ.com

title: MLB rumors: Yankees could chase Zack Greinke - NJ.com
text:
Comments 
Could the Yankees make a run at Dodgers ace Zack Greinke? 
They'll at least be in the market for big-time starting pitching, according to a report from CBS Sports' Jon Heyman. 
The report said Greinke will opt out of his contract at the end of the season and many believe the 31-year-old righty will get a deal worth as much as $150 million over five years. 
Greinke could win the National League Cy Young award after going 19-3 with a 1.66 ERA this season. 
The report also ran down a list of teams who could be in play for Greinke or another marquee starter, such as David Price, who's set to become a free agent. The Yankees have also been linked to righty Jeff Samardzija . 
From the report: 
In addition to the incumbent Dodgers, several more big-market and others teams are expected to be in the hunt for top starting pitching, including the rival Giants plus the Red Sox, Cubs, Yankees, Tigers, Diamondbacks, Phillies, Marlins, Blue Jays, Cardinals, Braves, Rangers (and more). 
PLUS: Uh oh, Mets: Chicago Cubs 'similar to' Boston Red Sox that stunned Yankees 
The Yankees have shown restraint in the high-price free-agent market since committing more than $400 million to starting pitcher Masahiro Tanaka, outfielders Carols Beltran and Jacoby Ellsbury and catcher Brian McCann before the 2014 season. 
But they — like any team — could use an ace-type starting pitcher, for a number of reasons. Tanaka hasn't shown that he's No. 1 quality, and health issues still haunt him, CC Sabathia, Michael Pineda and Nathan Eovaldi. 
Brendan Kuty may be reached at bkuty@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @BrendanKutyNJ . Find NJ.com Yankees on Facebook .
